section.name: Introduction
section.p: jDTAUS Core provides a common application programming interface for jDTAUS integration. It is split into various artifacts providing flexible integration facilities. The Core API artifact provides interfaces to core application services like task monitoring or modular implementation management. The Core Utilities artifact provides core utility implementations which may be used together with the Core API artifact if desired.

As with all jDTAUS API artifacts the corresponding application runtime needs to be assembled manually. Whenever the Core API artifact is used at compile time (whether pulled in transitively by e.g. the Core Utilities artifact or requested), the application assembler needs to provide additional runtime artifacts (see below) for proper operation.

subsection.name: Container Adapters
subsection.p: The client container adapter provides the jDTAUS Container reference implementation and implements a runtime suitable for standalone, single-user client applications. The servlet container adapter extends that runtime for web applications and is only needed for integration into web applications.
Note: Web applications must be configured manually to work correctly with jDTAUS. See ServletFilter.

subsection.name: Logging Adapters
subsection.p: Three logging implementations to choose from. JDK 1.4, Log4J or Commons logging.

subsection.name: Task Monitoring Adapters
subsection.p: Two task monitoring implementations to choose from. The client monitor adapter implements a runtime suitable for client applications displaying progress to the users. The server monitor adapter implements a runtime suitable for server applications not displaying progress to the users. The different behaviour is documented in the corresponding implementation classes. See the client and server API documentation.

subsection.name: Runtime Environment Adapters
subsection.p: Currently only the reference implementation is available.

subsection.name: Implementation programming interfaces
subsection.p: The Core SPI artifact provides interfaces to be used by implementations to expose core application services to applications. The above runtime artifacts all share the Core SPI artifact at compile time so that it will almost ever be pulled in transitively during application assembly.

subsection.name: Maven 2 Repository
subsection.p: As of April, 2007 all jDTAUS artifacts are provided via the central Maven 2 repository. No special configuration is needed any more.
